intro: Papaver rhoeas var. violaceum, commonly known as the violet poppy, is a variant of the common poppy characterized by its striking violet to purple flower color. It is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically growing to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers with a dark central stigma. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The violet poppy is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its unique coloration.
